alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Deuel; Garden; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Arthur, northwestern Keith, southeastern Garden and northeastern Deuel Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 640 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles west of Arthur to 9 miles north of Lewellen to near Oshkosh. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oshkosh, Lewellen, Lemoyne, Eagle Gulch Campground, Ruthon, Clear Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Otter Creek Campground, Lake View Campground, Ash Hollow State Historical Park, Belmar, Bourquim Hill, Bluewater Battlefield State Historical Park and Windlass Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 100 and 110. Highway 92 between mile markers 115 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near Lake McConaughy, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
